sfapp.description: comma-separated list of flag names that it is okay to specify on the command line even if the program does not define a flag with that name. IMPORTANT: flags in this list that have arguments MUST use the flag=value format
sfapp.name: undefok

sfapp.description: Number of columns to use in output for tab completion

sfapp.name: helppackage

sfapp.description: show help on only the main module for this program
sfapp.name: helpshort

sfapp.description: produce an xml version of help
sfapp.name: helpxml

sfapp.description: log messages go to these email addresses in addition to logfiles
sfapp.name: alsologtoemail

sfapp.description: log messages go to stderr in addition to logfiles
sfapp.name: alsologtostderr

sfapp.description: color messages logged to stderr (if supported by terminal)
sfapp.name: colorlogtostderr

sfapp.description: Drop in-memory buffers of log contents. Logs can grow very quickly and they are rarely read before they need to be evicted from memory. Instead, drop them from memory as soon as they are flushed to disk.
sfapp.name: drop_log_memory

sfapp.description: Emit a backtrace when logging at file:linenum.
sfapp.name: log_backtrace_at

sfapp.description: If specified, logfiles are written into this directory instead of the default logging directory.
sfapp.name: log_dir

sfapp.description: Put additional links to the log files in this directory
sfapp.name: log_link

sfapp.description: Prepend the log prefix to the start of each log line
sfapp.name: log_prefix

sfapp.description: Buffer log messages logged at this level or lower (-1 means don't buffer; 0 means buffer INFO only; ...)
sfapp.name: logbuflevel

sfapp.description: Buffer log messages for at most this many seconds
sfapp.name: logbufsecs

sfapp.description: Email log messages logged at this level or higher (0 means email all; 3 means email FATAL only; ...)
sfapp.name: logemaillevel

sfapp.description: Mailer used to send logging email
sfapp.name: logmailer

sfapp.description: log messages go to stderr instead of logfiles
sfapp.name: logtostderr

sfapp.description: approx. maximum log file size (in MB). A value of 0 will be silently overridden to 1.
sfapp.name: max_log_size

sfapp.description: Messages logged at a lower level than this don't actually get logged anywhere
sfapp.name: minloglevel

sfapp.description: log messages at or above this level are copied to stderr in addition to logfiles. This flag obsoletes --alsologtostderr.
sfapp.name: stderrthreshold

sfapp.description: Stop attempting to log to disk if the disk is full.
sfapp.name: stop_logging_if_full_disk

sfapp.description: Symbolize the stack trace in the tombstone
sfapp.name: symbolize_stacktrace

sfapp.description: Show all VLOG(m) messages for m <= this. Overridable by --vmodule.
sfapp.name: v

sfapp.description: per-module verbose level. Argument is a comma-separated list of <module name>=<log level>. <module name> is a glob pattern, matched against the filename base (that is, name ignoring .cc/.h./-inl.h). <log level> overrides any value given by --v.
sfapp.name: vmodule

sfapp.description: Number of active files in a set. One thread is spawned per active file
sfapp.name: pcachenumactivesetsize

sfapp.description: Number of outstanding slice syncing reads per SS
sfapp.name: outstandingsyncreads

sfapp.description: Number of pages to use in the buffer cache (overrides cachegb)
sfapp.name: buffercachepages

sfapp.description: Size in MB of each SS PCache File
sfapp.name: pcachefilesizemb

sfapp.name: numscachereplaythreads

sfapp.name: numbranchreplaythreads

sfapp.name: numlogfilereplaythreads

sfapp.description: Whether or not to include segment file cache in core files.
sfapp.name: coresegmentfilememory

sfapp.description: Amount of data read from pcache per call in bytes
sfapp.name: pcacheblockreadsize

sfbasiciocheck.description: log messages go to stderr instead of logfiles
sfbasiciocheck.name: logtostderr

sfbasiciocheck.description: approx. maximum log file size (in MB). A value of 0 will be silently overridden to 1.
sfbasiciocheck.name: max_log_size

sfbasiciocheck.description: Messages logged at a lower level than this don't actually get logged anywhere
sfbasiciocheck.name: minloglevel

sfbasiciocheck.description: log messages at or above this level are copied to stderr in addition to logfiles. This flag obsoletes --alsologtostderr.
sfbasiciocheck.name: stderrthreshold

sfbasiciocheck.description: Stop attempting to log to disk if the disk is full.
sfbasiciocheck.name: stop_logging_if_full_disk

sfbasiciocheck.description: Symbolize the stack trace in the tombstone
sfbasiciocheck.name: symbolize_stacktrace

sfbasiciocheck.description: Show all VLOG(m) messages for m <= this. Overridable by --vmodule.
sfbasiciocheck.name: v

sfbasiciocheck.description: per-module verbose level. Argument is a comma-separated list of <module name>=<log level>. <module name> is a glob pattern, matched against the filename base (that is, name ignoring .cc/.h./-inl.h). <log level> overrides any value given by --v.
sfbasiciocheck.name: vmodule

sfconfig.description: Enable the fake Carbon upgrade code
sfconfig.name: enablefakecarbonupgrade

sfconfig.description: Time RestAPIServer::Shutdown and kill it if it takes too long.
sfconfig.name: apiservershutdownkilltimer

sfconfig.description: Require HTTPS authentication when using API
sfconfig.name: auth

sfconfig.description: A version string to fake as our current API version.
sfconfig.name: fakecurrentapiversion

sfconfig.description: VMware VVols single PE administrative logical unit number
sfconfig.name: adminLuNumber

sfconfig.description: expose standard volumes as multiple LUNs within a single session
sfconfig.name: enableMultiLunSessions

sfconfig.description: VMware VVols temporary hack to expose all standard volumes as VVols
sfconfig.name: exposeVolumesAsVVols

sfconfig.description: store SCSI persistent reservation info in database
sfconfig.name: persistreservationinfo

sfconfig.description: Default state of sending Cluster Event traps enabled
sfconfig.name: defaultClusterEventTrapsEnabled

sfconfig.description: Default state of sending Cluster Fault Resolved traps enabled
sfconfig.name: defaultClusterFaultResolvedTrapsEnabled

sfconfig.description: Default state of sending Cluster Fault traps enabled
sfconfig.name: defaultClusterFaultTrapsEnabled

sfconfig.description: Default maximum number of configurable trap recipients.
sfconfig.name: maxTrapRecipients

sfconfig.description: Exit with non-zero error code on any startup flag errors
sfconfig.name: exitonstartupflagerror

sfconfig.description: Number of threads in the global thread pool. <= 0 means auto-detect.
sfconfig.name: globalpoolthreads

sfconfig.description: Directory to dump heapgrowth and memusagesample files (/ is invalid)
sfconfig.name: memusagedir

sfconfig.description: Whether or not BufferManager memory should be included in core files.
sfconfig.name: corebuffermanagermemory

sfconfig.description: Comma separated list of Marvell keys to blacklist and not consider as warnings or errors
sfconfig.name: marvellblacklist

sfconfig.description: Treat Marvell DataValid:No as an Error
sfconfig.name: marvelldatavalidiserror

sfconfig.description: Treat Marvell WriteReady:No as an Error
sfconfig.name: marvellwritereadyiserror

sfconfig.description: Status info for fake NVRAM device
sfconfig.name: nvramfakeinfo

sfconfig.description: Raw data for fake NVRAM device
sfconfig.name: nvramfakeraw

sfconfig.description: Status of a fake PCache device (OK, Warning, Error and Critical)
sfconfig.name: nvramfakestatus

sfconfig.description: Comma separated list of Radian keys to blacklist and not consider as warnings or errors
sfconfig.name: radianblacklist

sfconfig.description: Size of the SS slice file cache (in GB)
sfconfig.name: cachegb

sfconfig.description: Enable cluster fullness checks which prevent filling cluster to maximum capacity
sfconfig.name: clusterfull

sfconfig.description: Diagnose BS drive printing out all checksum and IO errors.
sfconfig.name: diagnoseBSBinFile

sfconfig.description: Time between drive monitor reads (in seconds)
sfconfig.name: drivemonitorinterval

sfconfig.description: Require a minimum of 3 nodes to create a cluster
sfconfig.name: minnodes

sfconfig.description: Number of parallel threads used during BS startup to read drive (default: 4)
sfconfig.name: parallelBSFileLoadThreads

sfconfig.description: Run the BS parser with the specified blockid file
sfconfig.name: parseBSBlockIDFile

sfconfig.description: Run the BS parser with the specified blockid file
sfconfig.name: parseBSBlockOutputFile

sfconfig.description: Run the BS parser and print all info
sfconfig.name: parseBSBlockPrintAllInfo

sfconfig.description: Run the BS parser and verify the data checksums
sfconfig.name: parseBSBlockVerifyChecksums

sfconfig.description: When bservice is ran, it will run in a read only mode and report faults when there is an invalid checksum or IO error
sfconfig.name: recoverBS

sfconfig.description: Service ID used to start block service and slice service
sfconfig.name: serviceid

sfconfig.description: Allow mounting USB drives to look for config files and report errors
sfconfig.name: usb

sfconfig.description: Fake hard failure of drives returning from failed state
sfconfig.name: fakebaddrives

sfconfig.name: decodetrace

sfconfig.name: decodetrace_buffersize

sfconfig.name: decodetrace_chunks

sfconfig.name: decodetrace_threads

sfconfig.description: Print ticks when decoding trace (to debug trace)
sfconfig.name: decodetrace_ticks

sfconfig.name: trBSBDT

sfconfig.name: trPCacheQueue

sfconfig.name: trSSBDT

sfconfig.name: trSliceLba

sfconfig.name: trVolume

sfconfig.name: disablestacktraces

sfconfig.name: fromenv

sfconfig.name: tryfromenv

sfconfig.description: comma-separated list of flag names that it is okay to specify on the command line even if the program does not define a flag with that name. IMPORTANT: flags in this list that have arguments MUST use the flag=value format
sfconfig.name: undefok

sfconfig.description: Number of columns to use in output for tab completion
sfconfig.name: tab_completion_columns

sfconfig.name: tab_completion_word

sfconfig.name: help

sfconfig.name: helpfull

sfconfig.name: helpmatch

sfconfig.name: helpon

sfconfig.name: helppackage

sfconfig.description: show help on only the main module for this program
sfconfig.name: helpshort

sfconfig.description: produce an xml version of help
sfconfig.name: helpxml

sfconfig.name: version

sfconfig.description: log messages go to these email addresses in addition to logfiles
sfconfig.name: alsologtoemail

sfconfig.description: log messages go to stderr in addition to logfiles
sfconfig.name: alsologtostderr

sfconfig.description: color messages logged to stderr (if supported by terminal)
sfconfig.name: colorlogtostderr

sfconfig.description: Drop in-memory buffers of log contents. Logs can grow very quickly and they are rarely read before they need to be evicted from memory. Instead, drop them from memory as soon as they are flushed to disk.
sfconfig.name: drop_log_memory

sfconfig.description: Emit a backtrace when logging at file:linenum.
sfconfig.name: log_backtrace_at

sfconfig.description: If specified, logfiles are written into this directory instead of the default logging directory.
sfconfig.name: log_dir

sfconfig.description: Put additional links to the log files in this directory
sfconfig.name: log_link

sfconfig.description: Prepend the log prefix to the start of each log line
sfconfig.name: log_prefix

sfconfig.description: Buffer log messages logged at this level or lower (-1 means don't buffer; 0 means buffer INFO only; ...)
sfconfig.name: logbuflevel

sfconfig.description: Buffer log messages for at most this many seconds
sfconfig.name: logbufsecs

sfconfig.description: Email log messages logged at this level or higher (0 means email all; 3 means email FATAL only; ...)
sfconfig.name: logemaillevel

sfconfig.name: logmailer

sfconfig.name: logtostderr

sfconfig.name: symbolize_stacktrace

sfconfig.name: vmodule

sfconfig.name: pcachenumactivesetsize

sfconfig.name: outstandingsyncreads

sfconfig.description: Number of pages to use in the buffer cache (overrides cachegb)
sfconfig.name: buffercachepages

sfconfig.name: pcachefilesizemb

sfconfig.name: numscachereplaythreads

sfconfig.name: numbranchreplaythreads

sfconfig.name: numlogfilereplaythreads

sfconfig.description: Whether or not to include segment file cache in core files.
sfconfig.name: coresegmentfilememory

sfconfig.description: Amount of data read from pcache per call in bytes
sfconfig.name: pcacheblockreadsize

sfsvcmgr.description: Exit with non-zero error code on any startup flag errors
sfsvcmgr.name: exitonstartupflagerror

sfsvcmgr.description: Number of threads in the global thread pool. <= 0 means auto-detect.
sfsvcmgr.name: globalpoolthreads

sfsvcmgr.description: Directory to dump heapgrowth and memusagesample files (/ is invalid)
sfsvcmgr.name: memusagedir

sfsvcmgr.description: Set the number of blocks in the shared memory segment. Must be a power of 2.
sfsvcmgr.name: blockcount

sfsvcmgr.description: Set the global core file pattern.
sfsvcmgr.name: corepattern

sfsvcmgr.description: Set to enable testing of dead services.
sfsvcmgr.name: killtest

sfsvcmgr.description: Minimum time in seconds between service start and service exit for a process to be excluded from being considered for thrashing.
sfsvcmgr.name: minstarttimespacing

sfsvcmgr.description: When bservice is ran, it will run in a read only mode and report faults when there is an invalid checksum or IO error
sfsvcmgr.name: recoverBS

sfsvcmgr.description: File containing the list of services to restore
sfsvcmgr.name: restoreservicesfile

sfsvcmgr.description: The period in seconds that the service manager waits between processing the stopped service list.
sfsvcmgr.name: schedulerperiod

sfsvcmgr.description: If true, services are started with serial instance values. Otherwise, services are started with random instance values.
sfsvcmgr.name: serialinstancevalues

sfsvcmgr.description: Service ID used to start block service and slice service
sfsvcmgr.name: serviceid

sfsvcmgr.description: Set the size of the shared memory segment used for IPC. Must be a multiple of PAGESIZE.
sfsvcmgr.name: sharedmemorysize

sfsvcmgr.description: Allows the user to disable the starting of the master service for debugging purposes.
sfsvcmgr.name: startmaster

sfsvcmgr.description: Number of seconds to wait after terminating a process before killing it with SIGKILL.
sfsvcmgr.name: stoppedproctimeout

sfsvcmgr.description: Time in seconds that the service manager waits before restarting a service that is marked as thrashing.
sfsvcmgr.name: thrashtimeout

sfsvcmgr.description: Number of consecutive times a process is allowed to restart in under minstarttimespacing seconds without it being marked as thrashing.
sfsvcmgr.name: thrashtriggercount

sfsvcmgr.description: # of seconds to wait before restarting a process exited with EXIT_ERROR_DELAY_RESTART.
sfsvcmgr.name: restartdelay

sfsvcmgr.description: Limit on the number of times a given service can dump core before the service manager will no longer restart that service. values <= 0 will result in no limit.
sfsvcmgr.name: servicecorelimit

sfsvcmgr.description: Log level for All areas (unless otherwise specified)
sfsvcmgr.name: laAll

sfsvcmgr.description: Log level for Remote Replication Block Data Transfer
sfsvcmgr.name: laBDT

sfsvcmgr.description: Log level for Block Service recycling
sfsvcmgr.name: laBSRecycle

sfsvcmgr.description: Log level for BufferManager and BufferMappedFile
sfsvcmgr.name: laBuffer

sfsvcmgr.description: Log level for Block Conflicts (unless otherwise specified)
sfsvcmgr.name: laConflict

sfsvcmgr.description: Log level for Per-Volume Efficiency and Capacity reporting
sfsvcmgr.name: laEfficiency

sfsvcmgr.name: laFS

sfsvcmgr.name: laNet

sfsvcmgr.name: laOWrite

sfsvcmgr.description: Log level for Quality of Service
sfsvcmgr.name: laQoS

sfsvcmgr.description: Log level for Slice Remote Replication
sfsvcmgr.name: laRemoteRep

sfsvcmgr.description: Log level for Report related logging
sfsvcmgr.name: laReports

sfsvcmgr.description: Log level for Master Service SS Monitor
sfsvcmgr.name: laSSMonitor

sfsvcmgr.description: Log level for Socket Service and Socket
sfsvcmgr.name: laSocket

sfsvcmgr.description: Log level for All areas (unless otherwise specified)
sfsvcmgr.name: lcAll

sfsvcmgr.description: Log level for Remote Replication Block Data Transfer
sfsvcmgr.name: lcBDT

sfsvcmgr.description: Log level for Block Service recycling
sfsvcmgr.name: lcBSRecycle

sfsvcmgr.description: Log level for BufferManager and BufferMappedFile
sfsvcmgr.name: lcBuffer

sfsvcmgr.description: Log level for Block Conflicts (unless otherwise specified)
sfsvcmgr.name: lcConflict

sfsvcmgr.description: Log level for Per-Volume Efficiency and Capacity reporting
sfsvcmgr.name: lcEfficiency

sfsvcmgr.description: Log level for Fibre Channel Service
sfsvcmgr.name: lcFS

sfsvcmgr.description: Log level for networking operations and utilities
sfsvcmgr.name: lcNet

sfsvcmgr.description: Log level for OutstandingWritesBitmap detailed logic
sfsvcmgr.name: lcOWrite

sfsvcmgr.description: Log level for Quality of Service
sfsvcmgr.name: lcQoS

sfsvcmgr.description: Log level for Slice Remote Replication
sfsvcmgr.name: lcRemoteRep

sfsvcmgr.description: Log level for Report related logging
sfsvcmgr.name: lcReports

sfsvcmgr.description: Log level for Master Service SS Monitor
sfsvcmgr.name: lcSSMonitor

sfsvcmgr.description: Log level for Socket Service and Socket
sfsvcmgr.name: lcSocket

sfsvcmgr.description: Capture allocation stacktrace every memory allocation
sfsvcmgr.name: captureallocstack

sfsvcmgr.description: RunSystemCommand timeout for command completion before forcing abort
sfsvcmgr.name: systemcommandtimeoutseconds

sfsvcmgr.description: Verify compatible cluster versions on cluster creation and node addition.
sfsvcmgr.name: checkclusterversions

sfsvcmgr.description: Verify identical cluster versions on cluster creation and node addition.
sfsvcmgr.name: checkclusterversionsexact

sfsvcmgr.description: Path to binary trace file to be decoded
sfsvcmgr.name: decodetrace

sfsvcmgr.description: Trace buffer size (0 means software will automatically choose a size)
sfsvcmgr.name: decodetrace_buffersize

sfsvcmgr.description: Number of trace chunks to decode at a time
sfsvcmgr.name: decodetrace_chunks

sfsvcmgr.description: Force trace decoding even if there is an md5 mismatch
sfsvcmgr.name: decodetrace_force

sfsvcmgr.description: Number of lines to sort for trace decoding, use 0 to disable.
sfsvcmgr.name: decodetrace_sortlines

sfsvcmgr.description: Number of threads for decoding trace file (0 means all hardware threads)
sfsvcmgr.name: decodetrace_threads

sfsvcmgr.description: Print ticks when decoding trace (to debug trace)
sfsvcmgr.name: decodetrace_ticks

sfsvcmgr.description: Trace for BS Block Data Transfer
sfsvcmgr.name: trBSBDT

sfsvcmgr.description: Trace for Primary Cache shortstop queue sizes
sfsvcmgr.name: trPCacheQueue

sfsvcmgr.description: Trace for SS Block Data Transfer
sfsvcmgr.name: trSSBDT

sfsvcmgr.description: Trace for tracing a slice write
sfsvcmgr.name: trSliceLba

sfsvcmgr.description: Trace for Volume R/W requests and completions
sfsvcmgr.name: trVolume

sfsvcmgr.description: Disable stacktrace collection even in debug builds
sfsvcmgr.name: disablestacktraces

sfsvcmgr.description: set flags from the environment [use 'export FLAGS_flag1=value']
sfsvcmgr.name: fromenv

sfsvcmgr.description: set flags from the environment if present
sfsvcmgr.name: tryfromenv

sfsvcmgr.description: comma-separated list of flag names that it is okay to specify on the command line even if the program does not define a flag with that name. IMPORTANT: flags in this list that have arguments MUST use the flag=value format
sfsvcmgr.name: undefok

sfsvcmgr.description: Number of columns to use in output for tab completion
sfsvcmgr.name: tab_completion_columns

sfsvcmgr.description: If non-empty, HandleCommandLineCompletions() will hijack the process and attempt to do bash-style command line flag completion on this value.
sfsvcmgr.name: tab_completion_word

sfsvcmgr.description: show help on all flags [tip: all flags can have two dashes]
sfsvcmgr.name: help

sfsvcmgr.description: show help on all flags -- same as -help
sfsvcmgr.name: helpfull

sfsvcmgr.description: show help on modules whose name contains the specified substr
sfsvcmgr.name: helpmatch

sfsvcmgr.description: show help on the modules named by this flag value
sfsvcmgr.name: helpon

sfsvcmgr.description: show help on all modules in the main package
sfsvcmgr.name: helppackage

sfsvcmgr.description: show help on only the main module for this program
sfsvcmgr.name: helpshort

sfsvcmgr.description: produce an xml version of help
sfsvcmgr.name: helpxml

sfsvcmgr.description: show version and build info and exit
sfsvcmgr.name: version

sfsvcmgr.description: log messages go to these email addresses in addition to logfiles
sfsvcmgr.name: alsologtoemail

sfsvcmgr.description: log messages go to stderr in addition to logfiles
sfsvcmgr.name: alsologtostderr

sfsvcmgr.description: color messages logged to stderr (if supported by terminal)
sfsvcmgr.name: colorlogtostderr

sfsvcmgr.description: Drop in-memory buffers of log contents. Logs can grow very quickly and they are rarely read before they need to be evicted from memory. Instead, drop them from memory as soon as they are flushed to disk.
sfsvcmgr.name: drop_log_memory

sfsvcmgr.description: Emit a backtrace when logging at file:linenum.
sfsvcmgr.name: log_backtrace_at

sfsvcmgr.description: If specified, logfiles are written into this directory instead of the default logging directory.
sfsvcmgr.name: log_dir

sfsvcmgr.description: Put additional links to the log files in this directory
sfsvcmgr.name: log_link

sfsvcmgr.description: Prepend the log prefix to the start of each log line
sfsvcmgr.name: log_prefix

sfsvcmgr.description: Buffer log messages logged at this level or lower (-1 means don't buffer; 0 means buffer INFO only; ...)
sfsvcmgr.name: logbuflevel

sfsvcmgr.description: Buffer log messages for at most this many seconds
sfsvcmgr.name: logbufsecs

sfsvcmgr.description: Email log messages logged at this level or higher (0 means email all; 3 means email FATAL only; ...)
sfsvcmgr.name: logemaillevel

sfsvcmgr.description: Mailer used to send logging email
sfsvcmgr.name: logmailer

sfsvcmgr.description: log messages go to stderr instead of logfiles
sfsvcmgr.name: logtostderr

sfsvcmgr.description: approx. maximum log file size (in MB). A value of 0 will be silently overridden to 1.
sfsvcmgr.name: max_log_size

sfsvcmgr.description: Messages logged at a lower level than this don't actually get logged anywhere
sfsvcmgr.name: minloglevel

sfsvcmgr.description: log messages at or above this level are copied to stderr in addition to logfiles. This flag obsoletes --alsologtostderr.
sfsvcmgr.name: stderrthreshold

sfsvcmgr.description: Stop attempting to log to disk if the disk is full.
sfsvcmgr.name: stop_logging_if_full_disk

sfsvcmgr.description: Symbolize the stack trace in the tombstone
sfsvcmgr.name: symbolize_stacktrace

sfsvcmgr.description: Show all VLOG(m) messages for m <= this. Overridable by --vmodule.
sfsvcmgr.name: v

sfsvcmgr.description: per-module verbose level. Argument is a comma-separated list of <module name>=<log level>. <module name> is a glob pattern, matched against the filename base (that is, name ignoring .cc/.h./-inl.h). <log level> overrides any value given by --v.
sfsvcmgr.name: vmodule
